questions.question: What is the chemical formula of DUT-8(Cu)?
What method was used for the desolvation of DUT-8(Cu) macrocrystals to obtain sample 2b?
At what temperature does the decomposition of DUT-8(Cu) macrocrystals start according to thermal gravimetric analysis?
Does the presence of Cu in DUT-8(Cu) lead to fundamentally different flexible behavior compared to Ni, Zn, and Co based compounds?
questions.answer: Yes, the presence of Cu leads to fundamentally different flexible behavior.

questions.question: Is the DUT-8(Cu) compound able to have flexible behavior if the size of the crystals exceeds the threshold minimum size?
questions.answer: Yes, DUT-8(Cu) can have flexible behavior if the size of the crystals exceeds the threshold minimum size.

questions.question: True or False: The DUT-8(Cu) system shows flexibility if the particle size is below 500 nm.
True or False: The macro-sized crystals of DUT-8(Cu) undergo a phase transition upon desolvation.
What is the effect of solvent exchange in the pores of DUT-8(Cu)?
questions.answer: Solvent exchange in the pores is able to induce rotation of the linkers, resulting in disorder-switching between monoclinic and tetragonal symmetries.

questions.question: What happens to DUT-8(Cu) macrocrystals during CO2 adsorption at 195 K?
questions.answer: A part of DUT-8(Cu)_op macro-crystals undergoes a structural 'breathing' transition.

questions.question: True or False: The desolvated submicron-sized crystals of DUT-8(Cu) show rigid behavior in the adsorption of CO2.
What is the role of HCl in the synthesis of DUT-8(Cu)?
questions.answer: HCl is used as a modulating agent to suppress fast nucleation and promote the growth of larger crystals.

questions.question: True or False: The thermal stability of DUT-8(Cu) is influenced by the particle size.
What does the constrained geometric optimisation of the Cu paddle wheel cluster suggest about its flexibility?
questions.answer: It suggests that the Cu paddle wheel cluster is more rigid compared to the Ni paddle wheel cluster.

questions.question: True or False: The macro-sized crystals of DUT-8(Cu) can form a solvent-free, open pore phase upon supercritical CO2 drying.
What is the impact of metal and rigidification of the op phase of DUT-8(Cu) compared to its Ni containing counterpart?
questions.answer: The op phase of DUT-8(Cu) is relatively stabilized, making it possible to obtain solvent-free macrosized crystals.

questions.question: True or False: The desolvated op phase of DUT-8(Cu) shows tolerance to slight divergence in the unit cell parameters.
What does the presence of an intermediate phase during CO2 adsorption at 195 K on DUT-8(Cu) indicate?
True or False: The structural transition observed in DUT-8(Cu) during CO2 adsorption at 195 K leads to irreversible structural changes upon desorption.
What is the effect of varying the activation procedure on the framework of DUT-8(Cu)?
questions.answer: Varying the activation procedure influences whether DUT-8(Cu) maintains the op phase or undergoes a transition to a new, nonresponsive dense phase.

questions.question: True or False: The flexibility of DUT-8(Cu) is governed by orthogonal factors such as desolvation stress and particle size, as well as the electronic configuration of the metal complex.
